meanings.definition: To make a strenuous effort to do something.
meanings.sent1: She was straining to lift the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The athlete was straining to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: He looked like he was straining to move the mountain with his bare hands.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was straining with emotion as she sang the high notes.
meanings.sent5: The old car engine was straining to start in the cold weather.

meanings.definition: To filter liquid through a porous material.
meanings.sent1: She was straining the pasta to remove the excess water.
meanings.sent2: The coffee maker has a filter to strain the coffee grounds.
meanings.sent3: He was straining the juice through a sock, which was a strange sight.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight was straining through the curtains, creating patterns on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The chef was straining the broth to remove any impurities.

meanings.definition: To stretch or force beyond the normal limits.
meanings.sent1: The tight jeans were straining against her waist.
meanings.sent2: The bridge was straining under the weight of the heavy trucks.
meanings.sent3: The balloon was straining to hold all the water inside.
meanings.sent4: His patience was straining as he waited for the delayed train.
meanings.sent5: The rope was straining as the ship pulled away from the dock.
